intro: Ceropegia volkartii, commonly known as the string of hearts, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white, attracting specific pollinators. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Ceropegia volkartii is popular as a decorative houseplant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
